operation.descriptionCdata:
ff4015e2-182e-4b3d-a87e-237ac7923a7b.description=
Determines the number of elements in the given JavaScript array.  If an element
is itself another JavaScript array, it only counts as 1 element; in other
words, it will not expand and count embedded arrays.  Null values are also
considered to be an element.

Examples\:
    The size of [ "apple", "banana" ] is 2.

    The size of [ "apple", "pencil", [ 0, 3, 5, -199 ] ] is 3.

    The size of [ "apple", null, "banana", null ] is 4.

    The size of [] is 0.

The description of the enclosing folder describes the JSON format with examples,
and the JSON format is described completely at http\://www.json.org.

Inputs

   array
      The JavaScript array whose elements will be counted.  The operation will
      return a failure if the array is not a JavaScript array; a normal OO list
      is NOT a JavaScript array.

Responses

   success
      The array is a valid JavaScript array, and the Result output will be
      populated with the count of elements in the array.

   failure
      The array input does not contain a valid JavaScript array.  Result
      will contain a message to that effect.  This will occur if the input
      array is not a valid JavaScript array.  For example, if presented with a
      common list value such as a,b,c it will fail because it lacks the
      enclosing brackets and the quotes around each string element.  You may
      wish to use a tool such as http\://www.jsonlint.com/ to help diagnose
      problems with JavaScript Object Notation.

Outputs

   Result
      The number of elements in the array.  Elements that are themselves arrays
      only count as a single element.
operation.name: Array Size

scriptlet.name: Operation Array Size (ec8ea330-8060-4cb3-8572-71358d32d20d)
